The scenario that is generally being presented is that if you have a blog, mention politics, and have over 500 readers, then you have to jump through a bunch of beurocratic hoops or be fined/jailed. The article linked would like you to believe that "Section 220 defining individuals or organizations reaching more than 500 people on a grassroots level with information about political issues as lobbying organizations, if the information can be construed as urging people to contact congress." This simply isn't the case. The bill is targeted towards "astroturfers", groups pretending to be grass root organizations, but that are actually fronts for big money. How do you tell the difference? Under this bill you would only need to file reports if you spent or received more than $25,000 a quarter for your efforts.
